concept.title: Network Location Manager Overview
concept.shortdesc: The Network Location Manager is responsible for obtaining a location fix from the network on behalf of the LBS Location Server.

section.title: Purpose
section.p: The Network Location Manager is used by the Location Server. It communicates with the Network Gateway to obtain a position from the network.

section.title: Required background
section.p: The reader should be familiar with the LBS architecture.

section.title: Key concepts and terms
section.p: There are no additional concepts for this component.

section.title: Architecture
section.p: The Network Location Manager is a process that runs as part of the LBS subsystem.

The Location Server sends requests for location to the Network Location Manager when the position quality criteria required by MO-LR (self locate) can best be satisfied by the network. The Network Location Manager interacts with the Network Gateway to obtain a location from the network.

section.title: APIs
section.p: The Network Location Manager is an internal component of the LBS subsystem. It does not expose any published APIs.

section.title: Typical uses
section.p: The Network Location Manager is only used internally by the LBS subsystem.
